results.headline: Little Cover Girls Star in an Adult Reality
results.summary_short: The documentary “Girl Model” details how the industry grooms young Russian girls to become models in Japan.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Girl Model

results.headline: Caught Between Rock Music and a Hard, Lonely Place
results.summary_short: A musician on the verge of divorce tries to find some connection to his estranged young daughter in So Yong Kim’s “For Ellen.”

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of For Ellen

results.headline: A Small-Town Buzz About the Missing
results.summary_short: The disappearance of children, and possibly a stranger’s role, is the talk of a depressed mining town in “The Tall Man.”

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Tall Man

results.headline: Finding Drama in Newfangled Filmmaking
results.summary_short: “Side by Side,” with Keanu Reeves, revels in the quickly changing technical side of filmmaking.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Side by Side

results.headline: A Child and a Box. What Could Go Wrong?
results.summary_short: In “The Possession,” a box that a child clings to is the source of all kinds of demonic mischief.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Possession

results.headline: No Bullet, but Plenty of Questions
results.summary_short: The plot of “The Bullet Vanishes” centers on two detectives trying to solve the killings at a factory in 1930s China.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Bullet Vanishes

results.headline: Oh, for a Nice Internist Who Makes House Calls
results.summary_short: A resident in internal medicine seems very strange in the psychological thriller “The Good Doctor.”

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Good Doctor

results.headline: Wishing On, and Seeking Out, a Star
results.summary_short: In “Hollywood to Dollywood,” Gary and Larry Lane, gay identical twins, travel from Los Angeles to the Dollywood theme park in Pigeon Forge, Tenn.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Hollywood to Dollywood

results.headline: Talk Is Cheap, Unless, of Course, It’s Dirty
results.summary_short: “For a Good Time, Call ...” is a phone sex comedy that does not try to be more than it really is.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of For a Good Time, Call...

results.headline: Tornadoes and Eunuchs on the Really Big Screen
results.summary_short: “Flying Swords of Dragon Gate,” directed and written by Tsui Hark, is a remake of a remake of a martial-arts classic, but the technology is novel for the genre.

results.headline: After a Life of Exile, He’s Taking on an Unusual Line of Work
results.summary_short: “Breathing,” the first film directed by Karl Markovics, follows a 19-year-old who takes a job in the Vienna city morgue.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Breathing

results.headline: More Like an Impostor Than an Innocent Abroad
results.summary_short: “The Ambassador,” a stunt documentary directed by Mads Brugger, follows a European adventurer seeking fortune in Africa.

results.headline: Lovelyloveville, Where Pillows Get Presents
results.summary_short: Silliness runs rampant for the Oogieloves and their young friends on screen and in the movie theater audience.

results.headline: Taking Flight From Misery, Only to Court Peril
results.summary_short: Unhappy teenage girls, seeking thrills, leave their homes for Los Angeles in this movie, which came out of a Sundance Film Festival workshop.

results.headline: Moonshine County That Is Stirred, Not Shaken
results.summary_short: John Hillcoat’s “Lawless,” with Shia LaBeouf, is set in Virginia’s moonshine country during the Prohibition era.

results.headline: Battling Themselves and Zombies
results.summary_short: In Douglas Aarniokoski’s new film, “The Day,” post-apocalypse survivors are hunted, inefficiently, by zombies.

results.headline: A Maelstrom of Horror in a Desert House
results.summary_short: A college grad and her beau get more than they bargain for when they go spruce up an investment home owned by her parents.

results.headline: No Breaks for a Rider in a Hurry
results.summary_short: “Premium Rush” stars Joseph Gordon-Levitt as a bicycle messenger racing around New York City.

results.headline: The Leisure Class Bears Its Burden
results.summary_short: “Neighboring Sounds” illuminates the present state of Brazilian society by exposing the complex relationships and simmering contradictions in its enclaves of privilege.

results.headline: Taming of the Steed
results.summary_short: “Wild Horse Wild Ride” is a documentary about the Extreme Mustang Makeover, a competition that assigns 100 trainers 100 wild mustangs to tame in 100 days.
